snippet: Alex Ovechkin won the Hart Trophy, awarded by hockey writers, while Sidney Crosby earned the Ted Lindsay award, chosen by players.
abstract: Washington Capitals winger Alexander Ovechkin and Pittsburgh Penguins center Sidney Crosby, NHL’s two highest-profile stars, split its two trophies for most valuable player; Ovechkin wins Hart Trophy, awarded by hockey writers, while Sidney Crosby earns Ted Lindsay award, chosen by players.
lead_paragraph: Alex Ovechkin won the Hart Trophy, awarded by hockey writers, while Sidney Crosby earned the Ted Lindsay award, chosen by players.

headline.main: Ovechkin and Crosby Split N.H.L.’s Top Honors
